learning_objectives.description: Understand and use set language, notation and Venn diagrams to describe sets and represent relationships between sets.
learning_objectives.notes_and_examples: Venn diagrams are limited to two or three sets. The following set notation will be used: n(A) Number of elements in set A, ∈ '... is an element of ...', ∉ '... is not an element of ...', A' Complement of set A, ø The empty set, ε Universal set, A ⊆ B A is a subset of B, A ⊈ B A is not a subset of B, A ∪ B Union of A and B, A ∩ B Intersection of A and B. Example definition of sets: A = {x: x is a natural number}, B = {(x, y): y = mx + c}, C = {x: a ≤ x ≤ b}, D = {a, b, c, ...}.
